meanings.definition: past participle of lie (to be in a horizontal position)
meanings.sent1: The cat had lain on the warm blanket all afternoon.
meanings.sent2: She had lain on the grass, enjoying the sunshine.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy puppy had lain in the sun so long, it had a tan!
meanings.sent4: The old book had lain undisturbed on the shelf for years.
meanings.sent5: The fallen leaves had lain in a colorful carpet on the ground.

meanings.definition: past participle of lay (to place something down)
meanings.sent1: The tools had lain neatly on the workbench.
meanings.sent2: She had lain the table with plates and cutlery for dinner.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat had lain the toy mouse in front of the sleeping dog.
meanings.sent4: The foundation had lain strong for generations, supporting the house.
meanings.sent5: The seeds had lain dormant in the soil until the rain came.
